description:
I have setup OpenStack to work with ceph. As far as I can see, everything is setup correctly. I can attach an ceph block device to a running instance. 

But I'm unable to boot a instance from a ceph volume.

The error is the same like in #1126348. 

2013-06-10 21:05:04.529 INFO nova.virt.disk.mount.nbd [req-541302fd-1519-4c55-ac0a-2df8a8dd8077 3bf575677f4748d59e1c8cb24a176d22 f936b4c4ecc5498aafc040f5d3c77e89] NBD mount error: qemu-nbd error: Unexpected error while running command.
Command: sudo nova-rootwrap /etc/nova/rootwrap.conf qemu-nbd -c /dev/nbd8 /var/lib/nova/instances/21a9c393-a2bc-45ee-997d-3b0f4a7ea319/disk
Exit code: 1
Stdout: ''
Stderr: "qemu-nbd: Failed to bdrv_open '/var/lib/nova/instances/21a9c393-a2bc-45ee-997d-3b0f4a7ea319/disk': No such file or directory\n"

The disk file or directory does not exist.

ii  nova-compute                     1:2013.1.1-0ubuntu2~cloud0                 OpenStack Compute - compute node
ii  nova-compute-kvm                 1:2013.1.1-0ubuntu2~cloud0                 OpenStack Compute - compute node (KVM)
ii  ceph                             0.56.4-0ubuntu1~cloud0                     distributed storage and file system
ii  ceph-common                      0.56.4-0ubuntu1~cloud0                     common utilities to mount and interact with a ceph filesystem
ii  libcephfs1                       0.56.4-0ubuntu1~cloud0                     Ceph distributed file system client library

I installed the package from deb http://ubuntu-cloud.archive.canonical.com/ubuntu precise-updates/grizzly main. The OS is Ubuntu 12.04.2.
title: Boot from ceph volume fails

comments.content:
So disabling libvirt partition injection appears to solve this problem for me:

libvirt_inject_partition=-2
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hopem

comments.content:
fyi it has been suggested that nova should be using config drive/metadata api instead of injected info in this case.

See http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content/config-drive.html for more info.
